iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Renewable energy for sustainable universal ecology
iati-activity.description: Aim: Pilotting a small-scale biogas production unit and wind turbines for a primary school; enhancing the use of renewable energy by such solutions that can diversify the income of local people. Activities: Training; construction.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Ecovillage development concept for Koibatek district
iati-activity.description: Aim: Increase food security, diversify income generation and increase income through sustainable agricultural / forestry development. Activities: Mobilization and capacity building of village self-help groups; training on improved farming systems by using oil-producing species Aloe and Jatropha and by production of Acacia honey; support on proseccing, packing and marketing; development of community-based ecotourism.

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Aid to Kenya through IFRC
iati-activity.description: Flood relief.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Empowering Churches for Street Children Work. The programme aims to improve the capacity of a local partner to work with street children and orphans. In Kenya_ there are currently about 250Â 000 street children and 1.6 million AIDS-orphans_ and the amount is increasing. Many of the vulnerable children belong to both categories. Fida and the Full Gospel Churches of Kenya (FGCK) have worked together since 2001 to address the needs of these children and their families. The emphasis of the programme is on preventive work done through empowering families and communities. Local FGCK churches are encouraged to start their own programmes_ which are then supported in terms of training and small-scale financial assistance. In the capital_ Nairobi_ the programme runs a street children rehabilitation centre. The programme includes also child sponsorship. Through the programme_ FGCKâs skills and know-how in working with street children and orphans are built up. Through FGCKâs work_ the life management of vulnerable children will improve.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Empowering Maasai Girls and Communities in Narok District. The project focuses on empowering a local partner to work with Maasai girls and their communities in the Narok region. The position of women and girls in the Maasai society is quite poor. The Maasai have a tradition of practicing female genital mutilation (FGM) and early forced marriages. For women_ these practices are harmful and many Maasai girls run away to escape them. In 1997 the local Full Gospel Church in Narok established a safe-house for such Maasai girls. Later the church asked for Fidaâs assistance to make a wider impact on the Maasai communities. In addition to the safe-house_ which is supported through child sponsorship_ the programme now includes various components. The programme offers training for the partner in e.g. Community Health Education (CHE) and HIV/AIDS questions. Adult education in the local Maasai communities is also an essential part of the programme. Maasai girls are also supported and encouraged to enter high school and postgraduate studies_ when possible. Through the programme_ the partnerâs capacity to work with the Maasai communities increases. And as a result of effective development work_ the attitudes and practices among the Maasai begin the change. This_ in turn_ will improve the overall status of Maasai girls.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Transforming street children through youth associations
iati-activity.description: Aim: contribute to improved livelihood for street, working children and at-risk youth. Rehabilitate and integrate children/youth into the society; reduce glue sniffing among street children/youth. Activities: establish and strengthen the self-regulation street children associations;carry out peer-to-peer training/awareness raising and rehabilitation; vocational training; returning children back to schools; improve income generating activities

location.name: Nairobi, Kisumu, rural towns around these cities

iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Nairobi
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Nairobi

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / For Kenyan Schoolchildren at Lusoi Primary School
iati-activity.description: For Kenyan Schoolchildren at Lusoi Primary School. Community development by raising the level basic education_ renovation of the school and providing material for the education needs.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Empowering rural and urban girls with income generating skills
iati-activity.description: The empowering of 120 girls from very poor backgrounds in Catering and Hospitality Management skills_ to help them to earn a stabel income by being qualified to get employment or start their own business. 200 women acquire or improve encome-generating skills and apply them in their ordinary living surroundings through learning basics in hygiene_ nutrition and business skills.

iati-activity.title: Kenyan Gender and governance programme 3 phase
iati-activity.description: Finland has supported Kenya_s Gender and Governance Program in 2007-2008. The program strives to promote women_s civil and political rights as well as to increase women_s possibilities to participate in the political decision-making on its different levels. In the third phase of the program (2009-2011) the main focus is in the policy and legislative questions. Finland is meant to support the third phase with 1_5 million euros.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Development Fund for Women

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Community Action Project Strengthening the Resilience and Protection of Children and Youth Affected by HIV and Aids in Kisumu. To improve quality of life and resilience of orphans and other vulnerable children and youth in Kisumu and to strengthen community-led responses to protect and care for them.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Engaging Youth for Advocacy and Good Governance. To strengthen youth and youth organizationsâ capacity to engage in decision-making processes and in advocacy for good governance and better service provision. To contribute to the development of competent youth leaders and organizations and their networking

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Community based Disaster Risk Reduction and Management. To reduce vulnerabilities and strengthen children_s and communitiesâ capacity to cope with disasters by strengthening community structures for effective coordination and harmonization of disaster risk reduction and response initiatives

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Development of a Community-based UBR Model. To develop a decentralised and community-based UBR process in cooperation with local authorities and Nokia

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Kariobangi HIV Project. The overall objective of the project is improved livelihood for 300 OVC in Korokocho slums in Nairobi. Main activity is to arrange vocational training for the youth.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (World Vision)
iati-activity.description: Child Participation and Enpowerment of Children. The overall objective is promoting awareness and implementation of child rights and childrenÂ´s participation in the North Rift area

iati-activity.description: Mogotio Area Development Project. The overall objective is to enhance community`s capacity to initiate and manage sustainable development.The design document for implementation is being designed.

iati-activity.description: Tinderet Area Development Project. The overall objective is to enhance community`s capacity for long term development. The assessment is ongoing.

iati-activity.description: Sook Area Development Programme. The overall objective is to enhance community`s capacity for long term development. The assessment is ongoing.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Frikyrklig samverkan FS rf)
iati-activity.description: Kenya_ Community Center. The purpose of the project is to increase the income for poor farmers and their families in rural Cambodia. This is done through different projects in the villages

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Grass Garden Display at the Nairobi Botanical Garden. The project aims to conserve grasses while incorporating the existing features into a display of economically important and endangered grasses in Nairobi at National Museum of Kenya_s Botanical Garden. The objectives are to display as wide a range of grass species as detailed in the above categories_ to display ornamental grasses including classic lawn species and larger decorative species to help in revenue generation in order to display and help conserve endemic/endangered grasses of Kenya and to create a vista and ampi theatre/seating area with an interpretation facility for the visitors. The grass garden shall be divided into two main sections i.e the decorative display area and the informative/educational area. As a result there will be a live display of the Economically important grasses and an education facility for fire ecology_ livelihoods such as pastoralism and biotechnology in soil erosion control.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Risk Assessment and Protection Training for Human Rights Defenders. The funding goes to organise a security and protection training for Human Rights Defenders in Kenya_ the aim of which will be two-fold: firstly to focus on the immediate security and protection needs of HRDs in Nairobi and secondly to ensure the implementation of longer-term security plans amongst ten key human rights organisations in Nairobi.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Alternative Source of Livelihood for Women Fisherfolk. The project will increase the level of economic benefit of women fishers through the creation of economic enterprises in the fishing industry which also addresses some of the causes of natural resource/biodiversity degradation and relieving fisheries pressure on Lake Victoria. The project will promote and conserve threatened fish breeding grounds_ build the awareness and capacity of fisherfolk_ provide a more stable source of income to the women and improve household income and therefore alleviate poverty.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Childline Kenya, Child Protection. 1. Improving access, response and overall quality of services on the national helpline 116. 2. Research and adoption of alternative affordable technologies and innovation for child protection. 3. Building the capacity of government officers, staff and volunteers as well as selected referral partners for effective response and case management. 4. Increasing involvement of children in child protection programmes by empowering them with skills for enhancing safety. 5. Building the capacity of Childline Kenya to effectively meet its targets and implement the strategic plan.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Eastern Africa Advocacy Advisor, Kenya

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Integrated Health programme . To improve the lives and the general health conditions of vulnerable communities in South Kitui through the promotion of the water and sanitation activities.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Eastern Africa Regional Field Office . The overall objective is to improve effectiveness, quality and impact of the programmes focusing on the thematic areas, sustainable livelihoods, stable societies and rights and participation through established field presence.
iati-activity.sector: Support to local and regional NGOs

iati-activity.title: Support to the Water Services Trust Fund (WSTF)
iati-activity.description: The purpose is to enable the WSTF to further assist the grass roots organisations such as Water Resources Users Associations (WRUAs) and Community Based Organisations (CBOs). These organisations address at the local level a multitude of activities concerning water resources management and water and sanitation for improved equitable access of water of quality and quantity in ecologically sustainable development. The project is aimed to improve water access, sanitation and address the abuse and degradation of the environment and declining water availability and water quality. Support to poor communities in Kenya in addressing climate change through improved Water Resources Management and Water Services Provision.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Empowerment for persons and families with intellectual disability
iati-activity.description: The basic idea is to support families, relatives and PWD's in the respective roles in order to empower them to better quard their interests and improve their life situation. This will be reached through meetings with parent groups, teachers in special education institutes, social and health workers; vocational training and education of coordinators, parents, PWD's; HIV/AIDS program.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Kinship Care - Seeking community alternatives for children living away
iati-activity.description: Kenya lacks a policy for alternative care for children away from home. About 300,000 children stuck in orphanages could be placed in kinship care. Kinship care is recognized as providing a host of benefits for children over other forms of alternative care such as orphanages. Primarily, it enables children to remain with familiar carers, reducing the need for separation from loved ones, and preserving attachments and a sense of identiti. Goal is to improve the well-being and protection of most vulnerable children by strengthening the regulatory framework and community in the provision of alternative care for children in Kenya and practical means is to develop and support the model structure in certain communities that encourages kinship care and family based alternatives for institutions. There is a joint program between Interpedia, Adoptions Centrum (Sweden) and Little Angels Network.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / The moon plays for Kibera
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project is to help the orphan, abandoned children in the Kibera slum in Nairobi. There will be constructed more class rooms for the school maintained by the local partner organisation, diversify the pedagogy of the centre, get more teaching aid and add drama and vocational training to the curriculum. Project starts up a football team and develops junior football league between the slums. Basic health care and daily nutrition in the centre is also supported.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Upgrading the vocational skills for the youth of Nakuru
iati-activity.description: Developing vocational training in Nakuru Kenya.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Improving future opportunities for severly injured and hadicapped
iati-activity.description: The project idea is to provide a sustainable process to enhance livelihoods and future opportunities of local handicapped and severely injured children. The process will be implemented through community-based rehabilitation, to activate communities and municipalities to pick up the challenge. Kendu hospital will be the headquarter for the training activities and office infrastructure. A new surgical theatre will be set up in the hospital campus.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Development and Dissemination of Improved Pyrolytic Stove
iati-activity.description: Food security and access to energy are development issues that will probably be affected by climate change. The project develops anila pyrolytic stove which could use biomass efficiently and produce biochar that can be used as soil amendment. Anila stoves are developed to meet the local needs. Materials, designs and concepts to maximize efficiency are tested, and local expertise and maintenance ability are developed.

location.name: Central, western and parts of eastern Kenya (rift valley)

iati-activity.title: Improving the safety in the feed-dairy chain
iati-activity.description: Strengthening capacity of the Kenyans to improve safety in the feed-dairy chain- Improvement of food security through better management practices of feeds and foodstuffs. Activities are training to monitor dangers related to foodstuffs and analysing and managing risks and establishment of a reference laboratory.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Strengthening Governance Structures of Forestry Society of Kenya. Forestry Society of Kenya has recognized the importance of forestry in contribution to Millennium Development Goals. The project will strenghten governance relating to promotion of equal opportunities, participation for men, women and youth and reduce environmental risks as well as social problems such as HIV/Aids that affect the members of the Society. The project will increase production and employment in the forest, establish participatory forestry management and palnataion schemes and increase women membership.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Enhancin Women's Participation and Access to the Women's Enterprise Fund. Training programme for the poorest of the poor rural women in applying and using the special government's Women's Enterprise Fund.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Human Rights Film Festival; Reflections of Healing. Human rights film festival on reflections on healing. A programme geared towards human rights and conflict resolution using international and local films and documentaries to open discussion in communities and between different communities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Community Led Agro Forestry Project. Training of small scale farmers in agroforestry, tree planting and establishing tree nurseries.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Ethics and Integrity Advocacy. A pro poor integrity initiative to advocate ethics and intergrity and initiate networking among philosophy academia in East Africa and capacity building in local public administration to realize the Millennium Development Goals.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Short rotation commercial charcoal and fuelwood production in rural Keny. Commercial growing of trees for supply of wood to provide farmers with money and wood fuel, contribute to ecological stability of the country and still achieve conservation of land and biodiversity. The project activities; raising of tree seedlings, planting more trees on farms and building capacity of the grass roots institutions to ensure sustainability of the project activities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: provision of orthopaedic and mobility devices to persons with disabiliti. To enhance and strengthen the production and distribution of orthopaedic mobility devices through APDK network branches and satelite hospitals/ units to children and persons with disabilities. To enhance the quality of life of children and persons with disabilites through improved mobility and accessibility to services, information and social integration.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Integrated Ecosystem Conservation and Management of Mau Forest Complex. The project underscores the importance of establishing a forum for development actors, field based demonstration sites for showcased ecosystem conservation practices, a monitoring system to tract impacts and outcomes, and a mechanism for sharing data and infomation on on-going conservation initiatives within the Eastern Mau Forest Complex. The ecosystem is currently faced with land degration, increased human health due to pollution of river systems with high faecal loadings, escalating resource-based ethnic conflict which has eroded consultative utilisation of renewable resources across the watershed communities, and degraded landscape, hydrological and ecological systems.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Redressing dev. inqualities and increasing participation of marginalized. Redressing development inequalities and increasing participation of marginalized sectors (women, men and disabled) in the management of devolved funds through enhanced capacity to undertake social audit. The project will engage with and trnsform the grassroots structures, processes, planning and management of community development fund in four Asal constituencies in Eastern province. The project will strive to create alternative forums from the formal CDF working channels for women, youth and people with disability to learn and engage with CDF management processes and make their needs and priorities recognised and addressed in local development planning.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Community and Institutional Empowerment Initiative in Western Kenya. The organization will spearhead a grassroots governance project to create capacity for good governance at the grassroots level. The project will introduce good governance practices by mobilizing and sensitizing communities, facilitating capacity building with grassroots organisations and enhancing the capacity of local people to monitor public resources. This will ensure that communities directly stimulate the governnace projects and as a result, have more information and influence about the management of public funds.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Youth in Action for Economic Self - Reliance, Political Participation. Following the controversial outcome of the 2007 presidential election most parts of Nyanza province were affected by acts of violence and severe destruction mainly perpetrated by the youth. These events of lawlessness and social unrest destabilised the country and took a heavy toll on democracy. The project will address the issues affecting the youth and define effective strategies and innovative approaches that provide young people with real opportunities to use their potential for peace building, involvement in economic development and ways of demanding for transparent and accountable local governance.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: use of puppetry in school as a teaching aid and for environmental conser. The objective of the school based project is to promote the use of puppetry as a viable means of enhancing learning, promoting creativity and effective medium as a tool for Kenyan teachers and students and to sensitize and mobilize communities on environmental issues.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Rural Bio-diesel - Use of forest resources to produce bio-fuel. the project main goal is to increase the output of biodiesel through a number of activities including expansion of trees on-farm, establishment of seed collection centre's, purchase and installation of improved oil extraction machine and establishment of quality control facility. The project serves as a demonstartion and education tool, whereby the aim is to disseminate the practices for the benefit of other forest adjacent communities programs. The project aims to increase efficiency of the biodiesel production process, expand the resource base and increase returns to the local collecters, who comprise 60% women.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Consumer markets for sustainable poverty alleviation. Kenya is endowed with a remarkably diverse natural resource base. Unsustainable harvesting is threatening not only a valued biodiversity resource, but also a unique wild resource that has the potential to significantly contribute to livelihood creation and development of the country through formalized sustainable use. The project overall objective is to build on the significant capacity built during its previous phase to empower community based organizations to more ethically and sustainably produce conservation and development of products for increased market access and the resulting creation of livelihoods and the conservation of the natural resources it relies upon. The key focus of the project is to mutiply the beneficial livelihoods and conservation values achieved to impact an increased number of Kenyan CBO members.

iati-activity.title: Investment-related loan through Finnfund
iati-activity.description: Investment-related loan through Finnfund, Power plant.

iati-activity.title: Investment-related loan through Finnfund
iati-activity.description: Investment-related loan through Finnfund, Power plant.

iati-activity.title: ODA equity through Finnfund
iati-activity.description: ODA equity through Finnfund, Hotel construction and management.

iati-activity.title: Programme for Agriculture and Livelihoods in Western Communities
iati-activity.description: Programme for Agriculture and Livelihoods in Western Communities

location.name: Districts of Busia, Bunyala, Butula, Nambale, Samia, Teso South, Teso North in the Western Province of Kenya

iati-activity.title: KEN/Developing nursery and primary education in Yala District
iati-activity.description: Project aim is to improve basic education in Yala district where there are a lot of school drop-outs. There is a danger of social exclusion particularly for girls and other groups which have lower social status. Aim of the project is to allow equal opportunities for all children in the district, which improves development and welfare. Local partners have initiated and are administrating the project.

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Aid to Kenya through WHO
iati-activity.description: Humanitarian Aid to Kenya through WHO.

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian aid to Kenya through UNHCR
iati-activity.description: Humanitarian assistance through UNHCR refugee programmes to Kenya
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

iati-activity.title: ICT capacity strenghtening in Kenyan schools to promote community
iati-activity.description: Goal is to provide equal opportunities for education to children in less developed rural areas in Kenya. Thios is done by providing access to modern IT and e-communication with the partner school in Finland, empowering the students to integrate the global system.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Suomen Rotaryn piiri nro 141 ry

location.name: Rift Valley Province in Kenya, Cheplaskei and Anin

iati-activity.title: Nairobi Embassy Planning Funds
iati-activity.description: Planning funds will be used i.a.for the preparation and monitoring of the Kenya development cooperation programme and to the training related to development cooperation.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Arid Lands Development Focus; The purpose of the project has been to enable the marginalized communities living in Wajir district to access justice, enjoy their legal rights as well as have other development benefits. The training has raised great interest in the community on the subject of paralegals. The trained paralegals have already formed a network, opened an office and are engaged in awareness raising activities in the community. The third phase will include training of evening larger group of paralegals in remote areas.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Advocacy action towards lobby leaders and communities to come up with a national as well as constituency level MDGs rescue plans. Specifically this action will raise the profile of the MDGs in the reforms process as part of agenda four. It will also develop a national MDGs breakthrough plan as well as take advantage of the constitution review process to raise stakes for environment conservation and particularly to galvanize commitment, rally support and spur collective action in order sustain the efforts conserve Mau Forest.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Investigating in capacity building, nature-based enterprises and business support to conserve the Dakacha Woodland by and for local communities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Enhancing community based forest conservation in Kibauni hill forest in Machakos to mitigate and adapt to effects of climate change through community empowerment and improved livelihoods.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Human Rights Defenders (HRDs) within the communities are easily targeted for harassments and persecutions. So far, the government's systems do not recognize the work of the human rights defenders as they see them as nuisance and destractors out to block economic activities and development policies. Legal and technical advice is therefore a necessity. Individuals, community leaders and human rights activists and defenders who face the security and protection incidences like threats of assasinations, made to disappear, tortured and ill-treated because they speak out for their economic, social and cultural rights and those of others, need to be empowered with skills to enhance their work.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Human Rights Workshop for Journalists. 4 return tickets Nairobi-Geneva, travel insurance, visa and per diem. Media21 Human Rights Workshops (HRW) intends to enhance and deepen the journalistsâ understanding of human rights principles and protection mechanisms. Through this workshop journalists will be provided with relevant information, including human rights definitions, legal frameworks and enforcement mechanisms, and with the necessary means to detect human rights violations and address relevant bodies for their necessary actions. Under international human rights treaties, States are responsible to respect, protect and fulfill obligations including prosecuting those responsible for human rights violations. Therefore, journalists will learn how to utilize these tools to detect human rights abuses, report on actions taken by the governments and to hold abusers accountable.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: The project will develop community members' level of awareness and skills in sustainable use of indigenous forest resources and assist them to establish viable and sustainable income generating activities based on indigenous forest resource in Transmara district.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Pastoralists Community Development Organization is based in Marsabit. PACODEO works with communities in the Northern parts of Kenya and intends to enhance empower and prepare communities and groups towards lasting peaceand coexistence of communities based on their discussed and debated facts. PACODEO promotes democracy, human rights and good governance.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: This project creates community self reliance in obtaining seeds, managing community based tree nurseries and carrying out a self help form of extension services. CEFIs partners in this project are 40 home associations. The project intends to create permanent forests blocks on residual pieces of farmland, sustainable agro-forestry systems and a program for annual harvests that ensures sustainable on-farm forestry.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Conservation and protection of Mau forest through introducing farmers and schools to grow trees for commercial purposes. Project objectives; 1) Increase tree cover within the greater Mau catchment in farms. 2)Support farmers and schools access market for tree products. 3)Initiatives to reduce wasteful consumption of wood fuel within homesteads. 4)Increase number of participating schools in tree planting. 5) Enhance environmental education in schools and communities 6) Support initiatives to conserve Mau Forest through planting indigenous trees.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Biodiversity-rich forests in western Kenya, which also act as major sources of the country's rivers were affected when violence broke out in Kenya following disputed presidential election results in 2007. The effects took the shape of displaced forestry officials from forest stations, encroachment into forest land with some people settling therein or cultivating forest land, illegal logging and fires. The KFS approached donors for assistance and a plan was put in place where support would come in through a consortium of donors. There is still need for NGOs to facilitate peace-building processes that will enable the other activities in the four components to be implemented.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: The Institute for Law and Environmental Governance works with development and implementation of appropriate natural resource management policies and better governance of the environment in Kenya. ILEG will assist the government in the development of the climate change response strategy and of REDD Readiness plan for Kenya. ILEG will also raise awareness of the Forest Act. Other activities are capacity building for Kenyan institutions working on forest law enforcement and governance as well as research.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: The Election Observation Group (ELOG), a national permanent and long-term domestic monitoring and observation platform, has been established as a comprehensive election observation programme with the aim of promoting transparency and accountability in the electoral processes in Kenya. ELOG proposes to monitor and observe the forthcoming referendum of the Constitution. It will monitor and observe the campaigns prior to the referendum through thematic observation, observe during the referendum day, and develop an interim and a final observation report after the referendum.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Kenya Human Rights Commission provides Civic action for Human Rights through building social movement, accountability and regional advocacy initiatives.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Institutional strengthening of CBOs in greater Machakos (Kangundo and Kalama) while promoting the achievement of the MDGs and Vision 2030. The project aims to continue creating awareness and education on why development is dependent on strong and sustainable community organisations. Organizational growth of community based organisations with good governance, leadership structures, sound planning and decision-making, systematic implementation and monitoring of community projects and local resource mobilization.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Grass Garden Display at the Nairobi Botanical Garden, National Museum

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Teso is generally a marginalised region. Illiteracy and poverty levels are still very high. In equal measure, human rights violations especially against the marginalised groups of the community like women, children and the elderly are prevalent. There are very few Civil society Organisations working in the area. There is further need for training to enable the CBO volunteers to understand human rights and governance more and to enforce those rights more competently and confidently. The proposed project is purposed to improve the attitude and working relationship between government agents and wananchi of different ethnic backgrounds.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: The project catalyzes a community-based rural bio-diesel industry that will generate economic opportunities to thousands of forest-adjacent communities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Ni Sisi Campaign will create a sophisticated multi-faceted communication system, which will be used to collect and disseminate timely information throughout the country, and promote responsible public discourse on the critical issues that need to be addressed to avert violence in the lead-up to and during the 2012 elections.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Project contributes to the achievement of peace and justice in northern Uganda by enhancing the capacity of human rights advocates and conflict transformation actors/ peace-building activists to relate and generate synergy.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
iati-activity.description: Civil Society organisations synergy for peace & Justice Northern Uganda. Northern Uganda suffered the scene of a brutal civil war between the government of Uganda and Lord resistance army. The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the achie
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: Promoting eco-sanitation and water services in peopleÂ´s settlement
iati-activity.description: 60 % of NairobiÂ´s population lives in settlements characterized by exclusion, overcrowding and insalubrious conditions. Majority of residents do not have access to decent and adequate sanitation. The purpose of the project is to improve access to sanitation services, improve sanitation marketing, business planning and hygiene promotion in the unplanned, informal settlements of Mukuru and Kibera. One bio-center with toilet and shower facilities and three composting latrines in two non-formal schools in Kibera will be constructed. Members of community will be trained in e.g. design and construction of bio-sanitation facilities, management and marketing of bio-sanitation services and hygiene promotion.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Wimma liikuttaa sinuakin ry
iati-activity.sector: Education and training in water supply and sanitation

iati-activity.title: Feasibility Study on Children Sponsorship in Kenya
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the project is to carry out a feasibility Study concerning changes in child sponsorship activity due to changes in Kenyan Law of Child Protection 2006. The law orders the relatives to take the children to custody from the Children's home. This is in many cases financially impossibile for the relatives.
